concept.title: Executing Pipeline Events in Data Preview

conbody.p: You can enable pipeline event execution in data preview to test event processing.

When you enable data preview pipeline event generation, the event framework typically generates only the pipeline start event. If the pipeline start event is configured to pass the event to an executor or to another pipeline, the event is passed and triggers the additional processing associated with the executor or pipeline.

Data preview only generates the pipeline stop event if the pipeline hits a stopping point within the data preview batch size. For example, say you have a pipeline where the origin is configured to pass a no-more-data event to a Pipeline Finisher executor, so that the pipeline stops when all available data is processed. If the origin contains only 15 records, you can set the preview batch size is 20 records and enable the pipeline event execution for data preview. When you start the data preview, it generates both the pipeline start and stop events.
To enable generating pipeline event execution during data preview, use the Enable Pipeline Execution data preview property.
